review_title: One of the best kept secrets in higher education.
pros:
Collaborative atmosphere. 
Work/life balance. 
Community engagement. 
Leadership. 
Get exposure to multiple administrative functions regardless of role/title.
Great benefits.
Pace of life in Danville is great! If you enjoy the buzz of a big city this Goldilocks town is not for you. The Norton Center, Center for the Arts, Bluegrass Band Festival, Heart of Danville, Chamber, etc. all will bring the world to you right there in Danville, Ky.
cons: Salaries start below industry norm for those not in senior leadership roles.

review_title: Hidden gem in the heart of the bluegrass, in all ways.
pros: Centre is a place with a heart. For every action it takes, it considers the impact on everyone the change will affect. The leadership is phenomenal from the top-down; regardless of department or role, everyone is welcomed and encouraged to pursue their interests and autonomy in the framework of company goals. The non-rigid management style allows for a real strong internal identity, and a visibly unified community externally.
cons: The stability of the company has some real benefits, but it also affects the trajectory of the institution. In some ways, the small turnover rate inhibits innovation in lieu of tradition. It tends to hire alumni, which has its benefits and drawbacks when considering the larger profile it wants to represent nationally and otherwise. Also, due to small size, it's a lot more difficult to advance one's career in title or salary.

review_title: Good job, better if you care about your residents
pros: This is one of the highest paying work-study jobs on campus, and it's nice that you get your own room. Developing connections with people you otherwise wouldn't know is really nice, within both the residence life staff at large and your residents.
cons: Enforcing the rules within a community that you're a part of can be really difficult. Despite an extensive summer training, the pro staff often encourages RAs and RDs not to use their judgment but to just report every little thing to them to deal with.

pros: Stimulating environment which revolves around holistic enrichment of each student. The professors are generally phenomenal across the board and genuinely care about their students and the subject that they teach.
cons: Very little flexibility in school policy and fairly difficult to make significant changes. The school is wonderful but the administration can at times feel very distant from student expectations.

pros: Flexibility. You get to set your own hours (so long as you put enough in). around your classes, tests, assignments, and whatever else you want. The material is also pretty interesting
cons: If you are working as a Research Assistant, you are paid minimum wage, no matter what your skills are, or how productive you are.

pros: the training was fantastic. You actually learned to be professional, which put me on the top notch when i first time entered the real word. Got chance to know really AWESOME people.
cons: it can be stressful, especially we all know how stressful you have to struggle academic wise. Yes, sometimes you felt bad to put your best friends' name on incident reports

job_title: Writing Center Consultant in Danville, KY
pros: The writing center provides a fun, relaxed environment with a fairly flexible schedule. Comparatively, its decent pay per hour for an on campus job.
cons: You don't get to schedule many hours per week. Usually only about six or so. If you are looking for a more substantial income, this may not be your best option.

pros: Good benefits. Decent pay for local sorroundings.
